required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess Immune Response to Multiple Doses of PF-06881894 or US-Approved Neulasta in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Randomized Open Label, Multiple Dose, Parallel Study To Assess The Immunogenicity Of Multiple Subcutaneous (sc) Doses Of The Proposed Pegfilgrastim Biosimilar (Pf-06881894) And Us-approved Neulasta (Registered) In Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the immune response to the proposed biosimilar PF-06881894 and the US-approved Neulasta reference product. Subjects will receive 2 subcutaneous injections (6 milligrams [mg]) either 1 of the 2 study drugs. Subjects will receive the first dose on Day 1 of Period 1 and the second dose on Day 1 of Period 2. Pre-dose and serial post-dose assessments of immunogenicity will be conducted each of the two treatment periods. In addition, safety assessments will be conducted throughout the study.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects with a negative baseline anti-pegfilgrastim antibody test result and confirmed postdose positive anti-pegfilgrastim antibody test result at any time during the study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 90 days (through Period 1 Day1 to Period 2 Day 60 or final visit)

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects with a negative baseline anti-pegfilgrastim antibody test result and postdose positive neutralizing antibody result at any time during the study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 90 Days (through Period 1 Day 1 to Period 2 Day 60 or final study visit)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Healthy males or females between 18 and 65 years of age (both inclusive) with body mass index between 19 and 30 kg/m2, inclusive, and body weight of not <50 kg or >95 kg, will be enrolled in this study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hematologic laboratory abnormalities (including leukocytosis [defined as total leukocytes >11,000/mcL], leukopenia [defined as total leukocytes <4000/mcL], or neutropenia [defined as absolute neutrophil count <1500/mcL] or thrombocytopenia [defined as platelet count of <150,000/mcL]) or other clinically significant abnormal laboratory evaluations.
- Lack of adequate hepatic or renal reserve.
- Any active systemic or immunologic disease or condition.
- History of biological growth factor exposure.
- Received live vaccination or exposure to communicable viral diseases within 4 weeks prior to Screening.
